intro: Epacris graniticola, commonly known as the granite epacris, is a species of flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Heath family (Ericaceae) and is characterized by its erect, sometimes branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in dry, sunny environments. Its flowers are usually pink or red, and it is well adapted to nutrient-poor soils. Epacris graniticola is often found in heathlands and open forests, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
